Key Match Events: Kyle Hendricks tossed 7 1/3 shutout innings while holding the Cincinnati Reds to only two hits in a 3-0 victory.
Kyle Hendricks received an ovation and curtain call from the fans at Wrigley Field.
Hendricks was pulled in the eighth inning by pitching coach Tommy Hottovy, receiving hugs from teammates and coaches.
Pre-Game Insights: Manager Craig Counsell told younger players before the game that Saturday would be a memorable day they would never forget.
Post-Match Reflections: Kyle Hendricks expressed his gratitude towards the fans and reflected on his career with the Cubs.
Ian Happ read off Hendricks' career accomplishments to the team in the clubhouse after the game.
Hendricks was presented with encased baseballs from each of his 22 outs to commemorate the day.
Manager Craig Counsell reflected on Hendricks' performance and contributions to the team.
Hendricks acknowledged the possibility of his career with the Cubs coming to an end as he enters free agency.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Hendricks' career includes a top-three Cy Young Award finish in 2016, starting Game 7 of the 2016 World Series, and having the ninth most strikeouts in franchise history.
Hendricks' impact on the organization goes beyond numbers, with teammates appreciating his character and mentorship.
Hendricks' commitment and consistency were highlighted by his teammates and coaches.
